summary: The "Raise the Wage Act of 2025" proposes to increase the federal minimum wage over several years, reaching $17.00 per hour. The bill also addresses minimum wage for tipped employees and newly hired employees under 20. It phases out the subminimum wage for tipped employees and young workers. Finally, it modifies wage provisions for individuals with disabilities, while also phasing out special certificates with a sunset on the issuance of new certificates and providing transition assistance. The effective date is set to be the first day of the third month after the date of enactment.
